circumstances: Evidence indicates that the airplane flew straight into the side of a 1,320 feet mountain at the 1,280 feet level. The recommended minimum flight altitude for this designated mountainous area, at night, is 3,500 feet. There was no evidence of any mechanical problems. The pilot, sole on board, was killed.
probable_cause:
Occurrence #1: in flight collision with terrain/water
Phase of operation: cruise
Findings
1. (f) terrain condition - mountainous/hilly
2. (c) in-flight planning/decision - poor - pilot in command
3. (f) light condition - dark night
4. (c) altitude - inadequate - pilot in command
